definition: to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
"speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)
to agree to and sign (a treaty etc)
to place an order/to book ahead
to conclude (treaty, contract, agreement etc)/to set up (a rule etc)
custom-made/made-to-order/to have something custom made/also written 定製|定制

sentences.english: Yes, the name is Mr. Orwell.
sentences.chinese: 有，是以欧威而先生的名字订的。

sentences.english: They booked us into a tuppeny-ha'penny hotel near the docks.
sentences.chinese: 他们为我们在离码头不远处订了个廉价旅馆。

sentences.english: I propose a sole agency aGREement for bicycles for a period of 3 years.
sentences.chinese: 我建议订专销自行车的为期三年的独家代理协议。

sentences.english: A: We need our order separated into three different boxes .
sentences.chinese: 我们订的货需要分装三箱。

sentences.english: Of course, I've booked the train tickets now. And Tom's looking forward to it.
sentences.chinese: 当然了，我已经订了火车票了，而且汤姆也很期待。

sentences.english: You ought to get theirs lefts or interest into a contract.
sentences.chinese: 你们必需把她们的权益订在合同中。

sentences.english: Yes, you have made a reservation of two deluxe rooms for two nights.
sentences.chinese: 是的，您订了两间奢华房，住两晚。

sentences.english: Yes, It's mine. And I have ordered another dish plain saute shrimps .
sentences.chinese: 是我的，我还订了一份清炒虾仁。

sentences.english: Staple the invoice to the receipt.
sentences.chinese: 把发货清单订到发票上。

sentences.english: We tried to book a room , but the hotel was full .
sentences.chinese: 我们试着订一间房，但旅馆已满。

sentences.english: Have the soles of your leather shoes lined with rubber to prevent them from wearing down.
sentences.chinese: 皮鞋订上橡胶底以防止磨损。

sentences.english: If the cargo space ought to be reserved, please send us the necessary application forms.
sentences.chinese: 假如要预订货舱，请将订舱表寄给咱们。

sentences.english: OK. You're booked in Room 609. Do you have any luggage?
sentences.chinese: 好了。您订的房间是609房。您有行李吗？

sentences.english: Oh, it was reserved an hour ago. How about this one?
sentences.chinese: 哦，那张桌子一个小时前有人订走了，这张好吗？

sentences.english: I would like a flight to Engl-and to arrive for Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 我要订圣诞节到英国的机票。

sentences.english: This time I order moue , cheap ok?
sentences.chinese: 这次订多点，便宜点好吗？

definition: to place an order/to book ahead
to reserve a seat/to book a table/reservation
to order goods/to place an order
group buying/collective buying/buying by a group of individuals who negotiate a discount for the group
hotel room with one double (or queen or king) bed
abbr. for 標準間|标准间[biao1 zhun3 jian1], standard (hotel) room
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax
